attributes.action: instigate an investigation into the continuing increases of SSRI & SNRI antidepressant drug (AD) prescriptions, over prescribing and Primary Care level diagnosis of depression; Office of National Statistics data show this drug class prescriptions increased between 1.2 & 2.2 million in years 1998 to 2004 & 2006; an annnual median increase of nearly 1.5 million excluding year 2005 - when exceptionally they only increased by 315.8 thousand.  2005 showed no counteractive increases in other AD class prescriptions or non-treatment of ‘depressed’ patient complaints! Also, the promoted ‘replacement’ decrease in older AD figures has not occurred.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
If drugs work, after initial prescription surge when licensed, total figures should stabilise, even reduce as patients recover, treatment courses complete & drugs stopped

Increases of 1.5 million per annum in SS/SNRI prescriptions indicate drugs not working &/or withdrawal syndrome (WDS) instrumental in dependency keeping patient on drugs, possibly for life & costs rising ad infinitum

Dec 2004, CSM ‘Expert Working Group on Safety of SSRI Antidepressants’ reported lack of efficacy & safety

WDS & severe adverse drug events (ADEs) are then acknowledge by manufacturers who originally informed et al: patients fault, original symptom re-emergence &/or new mental illness emergence

UK official view

ADE & WDS ‘mild & self limiting’ ‘occasionally severe’; Despite extensive opposing evidence!

Risk of drug induced aggression, akathisia & suicide ‘close monitoring’; Unachievable at out patient level!

All; ‘legally defendable’ providing patient cursorily informed of problem.

Populations better interests - ?
